metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20650 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A reachable Object::dictLookup assertion in Poppler 0.72.0 allows attackers to cause a denial of service due to the lack of a check for the dict data type, as demonstrated by use of the FileSpec class (in FileSpec.cc) in pdfdetach.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.6
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.6
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.6
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.6
libpoppler73 - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.6
poppler-utils - 0.62.0-2ubuntu2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.62.0-2ubuntu2.6').
